1.name: Our Town
1.description: Change comes slowly to a small New Hampshire town in the early 20th century.

2.name: Rebecca
2.description: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

3.name: Pinocchio
3.description: A living puppet, with the help of a cricket as his conscience, must prove himself worthy to become a real boy.

4.name: Strike Up the Band
4.description: Jimmy Connors and his girl-friend want to take part in Paul Whiteman's high-school bands contest, but they cannot afford the fare. But per chance they meet Paul Whiteman in person and are ...                See full summary »

5.name: The Grapes of Wrath
5.description: A poor Midwest family is forced off their land. They travel to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

6.name: The Great Dictator
6.description: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

7.name: Fantasia
7.description: A collection of animated interpretations of great works of Western classical music.

8.name: The Philadelphia Story
8.description: When a rich woman's ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

9.name: Pride and Prejudice
9.description: Mr. and Mrs. Bennet have five unmarried daughters, and Mrs. Bennet is especially eager to find suitable husbands for them. When the rich single gentlemen Mr. Bingley and Mr. Darcy come to ...                See full summary »

10.name: His Girl Friday
10.description: A newspaper editor uses every trick in the book to keep his ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying.

11.name: The Thief of Bagdad
11.description: After being tricked and cast out of Bagdad by the evil Jaffar, King Ahmad joins forces with a thief named Abu to reclaim his throne, the city, and the Princess he loves.

12.name: The Shop Around the Corner
12.description: Two employees at a gift shop can barely stand each other, without realizing that they are falling in love through the post as each other's anonymous pen pal.

13.name: The Mark of Zorro
13.description: A young Spanish aristocrat must masquerade as a fop in order to maintain his secret identity of Zorro as he restores justice to early California.

14.name: The Proud Valley
14.description: In a Welsh coal mining valley, a young man with a beautiful singing voice is called upon to make the ultimate sacrifice when a pit disaster threatens.

15.name: The Letter
15.description: The wife of a rubber plantation administrator shoots a man to death and claims it was self-defense, but a letter in her own hand may prove her undoing.

16.name: Foreign Correspondent
16.description: On the eve of World War II, a young American reporter tries to expose enemy agents in London.

17.name: All This, and Heaven Too
17.description: A duchess' irrational behavior toward the governess of her children triggers tragic events that will change her family's lives forever.

18.name: Dance, Girl, Dance
18.description: When a troupe of danseuses becomes unemployed, one of them takes up burlesque dancing while another dreams of performing ballet.

19.name: Gaslight
19.description: Twenty years after the murder of Alice Barlow, her house is finally occupied again. However, the husband from the couple who have moved in has a secret which he will do anything to keep hidden.

20.name: The Sea Hawk
20.description: Geoffrey Thorpe, a buccaneer, is hired by Queen Elizabeth I to nag the Spanish Armada. The Armada is waiting for the attack on England and Thorpe surprises them with attacks on their galleons where he shows his skills on the sword.

21.name: The Blue Bird
21.description: Mytyl and her brother Tyltyl, a woodchopper's children, are led by the Fairy Berylune on a magical trip through the past, present, and future to locate the Blue Bird of Happiness.

22.name: Waterloo Bridge
22.description: During World War I, believing her fiance to be dead, a young ballerina loses her job and is forced to turn to prostitution.

23.name: Swiss Family Robinson
23.description: A family setting out for a new life across the sea is shipwrecked on a deserted island. The family members collaborate to create a home for themselves in the jungle environment.

24.name: My Favorite Wife
24.description: Missing for seven years and presumed dead, a woman returns home on the day of her husband's second marriage.

25.name: Night Train to Munich
25.description: When Germany invades Czechoslovakia, the German and the British intelligence services try to capture Czech scientist Dr. Axel Bomasch (James Harcourt), inventor of a new type of armor-plating.

26.name: The Westerner
26.description: Judge Roy Bean, a self-appointed hanging judge in Vinegarroon, Texas, befriends saddle tramp Cole Harden, who opposes Bean's policy against homesteaders.

27.name: The Invisible Man Returns
27.description: The owner of a coal mining operation, falsely imprisoned for fratricide, takes a drug to make him invisible, despite its side effect: gradual madness.

28.name: The Ghost Breakers
28.description: A radio broadcaster, his quaking manservant and an heiress investigate the mystery of a haunted castle in Cuba.

29.name: Santa Fe Trail
29.description: In 1854, Jeb Stuart, George Custer and other graduates from West Point are posted to Kansas to help pacify the territory before railroad construction to Santa Fe can resume.

30.name: The Return of Frank James
30.description: Frank James continues to avoid arrest in order to take revenge on the Ford brothers for their murder of his brother Jesse.

31.name: The Mortal Storm
31.description: The Roth family leads a quiet life in a small village in the German Alps during the early 1930s. When the Nazis come to power, the family is divided and Martin Brietner, a family friend is caught up in the turmoil.

32.name: The Long Voyage Home
32.description: In 1940, the motley crew of the British tramp steamer SS Glencairn prepares the ship for its perilous voyage from the West Indies to Baltimore and then to England.

33.name: The Invisible Woman
33.description: An attractive model with an ulterior motive volunteers as guinea pig for an invisibility machine.

34.name: Kitty Foyle
34.description: A hard-working, white-collar girl from a middle-class family meets and falls in love with a young socialite, but she soon clashes with his family.

35.name: They Drive by Night
35.description: When one of two truck-driving brothers loses an arm, they both join a transport company where later, the other is falsely charged as an accessory in the murder of the owner.

36.name: Jud Süß
36.description: Infamous anti-Semitic Nazi propaganda historical drama about Duke Karl Alexander of Württemberg and his treasurer Süß Oppenheimer.

37.name: The Mummy's Hand
37.description: An ancient mummy is revived to destroy the invaders of the 3,000 year-old tomb of an Egyptian princess.

38.name: The Great McGinty
38.description: Dan McGinty has great success in his chosen field of crooked politics, but he endangers it all in one crazy moment of honesty.

39.name: Stranger on the Third Floor
39.description: An aspiring reporter is the key witness at the murder trial of a young man accused of cutting a café owner's throat and is soon accused of a similar crime himself.

40.name: Remember the Night
40.description: A shoplifter and her prosecutor fall in love, creating tensions for his career and family.

41.name: La fille du puisatier
41.description: A rural maiden's two suitors go off to war, leaving her pregnant.

42.name: Boom Town
42.description: Two buddies who rise from fly-by-night wildcatters to oil tycoons over a twenty year period both love the same woman.

43.name: One Million B.C.
43.description: Tale of Prehistoric survival and love between a male and a female belonging to opposing tribes that happened to be at slightly different stages of evolution.

44.name: Crook's Tour
44.description: Charters and Caldicott, touring in the Near East, are mistaken for German agents and handed in error a gramophone record which contains vital information for Britain's enemies.

45.name: Escape
45.description: 1938: A young man arrives in Hitler's Germany, frantically seeking information about his German mother, and finds she is pending execution at a concentration camp.

46.name: The Bank Dick
46.description: Henpecked Egbert Sousé has comic adventures as a substitute film director and unlikely bank guard.

47.name: The Green Hornet
47.description: A newspaper publisher and his Korean servant fight crime as vigilantes who pose as a notorious masked gangster and his aide.

48.name: Little Nellie Kelly
48.description: Irish colleen Nellie is in love with handsome Jerry Kelly, even though her father objects. Nellie and Jerry soon marry and announce plans to move to New York, which again angers Nellie's ...                See full summary »

49.name: Andy Hardy Meets Debutante
49.description: Judge Hardy takes his family to New York City, where Andy quickly falls in love with a socialite. He finds the high society life too expensive, and eventually decides that he liked it better back home.

50.name: Li'l Abner
50.description: The goings-on in the rural Southern community of Dogpatch, USA.
